Detailed Description

Aligns two grids and then computes their difference.

Author:
v.lakshmanan

Member Function Documentation

LatLonGrid edu.ou.asgbook.motion.AlignAndDifference.compute ( LatLonGrid  data0,
LatLonGrid  data1,
Pair< LatLonGrid, LatLonGrid >  uv,
int  MOT_SCALE 
) 

00020                                                                                                                   {
00021         LatLonGrid result = LatLonGrid.copyOf(data1);
00022 
00023         final float mot_scale = MOT_SCALE; // integer division truncates
00024         for (int i=0; i < result.getNumLat(); ++i){
00025             for (int j=0; j < result.getNumLon(); ++j){
00026                 // align by moving data0 to match up with data1
00027                 // then compute difference
00028                 int aligned0 = data0.getValue(i,j);
00029                 // find motion at this point
00030                 int motx = Math.round(uv.first.getValue(i,j) / mot_scale);
00031                 int moty = Math.round(uv.second.getValue(i,j) / mot_scale);
00032                 // grab pixel from old location
00033                 int oldx = i - motx;
00034                 int oldy = j - moty;
00035                 if (data0.isValid(oldx, oldy)){
00036                     aligned0 = data0.getValue(oldx, oldy);
00037                 }
00038                 int diff = data1.getValue(i,j) - aligned0;
00039                 result.setValue(i,j, diff);
00040             }
00041         }
00042 
00043         return result;
00044     }
